intro: Pulsatilla bauhini, commonly known as the meadow buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with prominent, rounded centers and heart-shaped leaves. Native to parts of Europe and Asia, it thrives in meadows and grasslands. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters and blooms in late spring to early summer. Its seeds are enclosed in a hairy, spiky structure that aids in dispersal by wind and animals.
